questiontext.text:
Exercise

Consider the circle centre at the origin and of radius {@r1@}.

  1. Write down the equation of this circle.

    [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. For the following points determine which lie on the circumference of this circle, which lie inside the circle and which lie outside the circle.

    \( (5,0)\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

    \( (0,-5)\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

    \( (4,3)\) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]][[feedback:prt4]]

    \( (-3,4)\) [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]][[feedback:prt5]]

    \( (2,\sqrt{21})\) [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]][[feedback:prt6]]

    \( (-2\sqrt{6}, 1)\) [[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]][[feedback:prt7]]

    \( (1, 4)\) [[input:ans8]] [[validation:ans8]][[feedback:prt8]]

    \( (4, -4)\) [[input:ans9]] [[validation:ans9]][[feedback:prt9]]

generalfeedback.text:
Consider the circle centre at the origin and of radius {@r1@}.

  1. \( x^2+y^2 = {@r1@}^2 = {@r1^2@}\) is the equation of the circle.

  2. \[ (x,y) \] \[ x^2+y^2 \] conclusion
    \((5,0) \) \( 25\) on cirlce
    \( (0,-5) \) \( 25\) on cirlce
    \( (4,3) \) \( 25\) on cirlce
    \( (-3,-4) \) \( 25\) on cirlce
    \( (2,\sqrt{21}) \) \( 25\) on cirlce
    \( (-2\sqrt{6},1) \) \( 25\) on cirlce
    \( (1,4) \) \( 17\) inside cirlce
    \( (4,-4) \) \( 32\) outside cirlce

The following figure demonstrates some of the points

Note that the circle centre at the origin and of radius 1 has a special name the unit circle.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
